active_learning.discussion_prompt: In a group discussion, debate the trade-offs between broad indemnification (unlimited liability) versus narrow indemnification (capped/excluded) for security failures in third-party software. Use NIST SP 800-161 to support arguments and consider impacts on vendor relationships and enterprise risk.
active_learning.peer_teaching: Explain the key concepts to a partner without using technical jargon.
active_learning.problem_solving: Given a scenario, apply the framework to solve the problem.

distractor_protocol.step: Identify common misconceptions about the topic
Ensure distractors are similar in length and complexity
Include partial truths that require deeper understanding

Consensus: 67.1% approval from 7 voters. Incorporate: - Learning Objectives: [insert full list above]. - Prior Knowledge: Basic contract law, vulns, SCRM. - Big Picture: Reduces financial risks in acquired software assessment. - Scaffolding Layers: [insert full 4 layers above, including NIST completions: SP 800-53 Rev. 5 SA-4(21) requires acquisition docs address supply chain protections; SP 800-161 Rev. 1 mandates SCRM in contracts. Sources: NIST SP 800-53 Rev. 5 (https://nvlpubs.nist.gov/nistpubs/SpecialPublications/NIST.SP.800-53r5.pdf), SP 800-161 Rev. 1 (https://nvlpubs.nist.gov/nistpubs/SpecialPublications/NIST.SP.800-161r1.pdf), SolarWinds case (CISA alerts), SaaS examples (AWS Master Agreement)]. - Active Learning: Weave in prompts for discussion/peer teaching/problems. - Real-world: SolarWinds supply chain attack as indemnification trigger.
